alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Custer; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 3:22AM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Cherry, eastern Hooker, northern Logan, northeastern McPherson, northwestern Custer, western Blaine and Thomas Counties through 345 AM CDT/245 AM MDT/... At 322 AM CDT/222 AM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Mullen to 14 miles south of Seneca to 10 miles north of Stapleton. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thedford, Dunning, Halsey, Seneca, Purdum, Brownlee, Highway 83 crossing The Dismal River, Highway 83 crossing the North Loup River, Brown Lake, Norway, Natwick, Kelso and Highway 97 crossing the Dismal River. This includes the following highways... Highway 2 between mile markers 187 and 244. Highway 97 between mile markers 54 and 65. Highway 83 between mile markers 118 and 170. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Blaine; Custer; Eastern Cherry; Hooker; Logan; McPherson; Thomas; Western Cherry
